Package ch.idsia.crema.factor

Interface Factor<F extends Factor<F>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericFactor, Operable<F>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BayesianFactor, CombinedFactor, ConditionalProbabilityTable, DividedFactor, ExtensiveVertexFactor, FilteredFactor, MarginalizedFactor, PriorFactor, SymbolicFactor, VertexFactor, VoidFactor
    public interface Factor<F extends Factor<F>>
extends GenericFactor, Operable<F>

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      F combine​(F other)
      Combine this factor with the provided one and return the result as a new factor.
      static Factor deterministic​(Strides left, int assignment)
      Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros) without parent variables.
      static Factor deterministic​(Strides left, Strides right, int... assignments)
      Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros).
      F divide​(F factor)
      Divide this factor by the given one
      F filter​(int variable, int state)
      Filter the factor by selecting only the values where the specified variable is in the specified state.
      F marginalize​(int variable)
      Sum out a variable from the factor.
      default F renameDomain​(int... new_vars)
      Replaces the IDs of the variables in the domain

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        F filter​(int variable,
         int state)

        Filter the factor by selecting only the values where the specified variable is in the specified state.

        Can return this if the variable is not part of the domain of the factor.

        Parameters:
        variable -
        state -
        Returns:

      • deterministic

        static Factor deterministic​(Strides left,
                            Strides right,
                            int... assignments)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros). Thus, children variables are determined by the values of the parents
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        right - Strides - parent variables
        assignments - assignments of each combination of the parent
        Returns:

      • deterministic

        static Factor deterministic​(Strides left,
                            int assignment)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros) without parent variables.
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        assignment - int - single value to assign
        Returns:
